  • View page source

sensortoolkit.calculate._intersensor_mean

This module computes the average of parameter values across all conurrently recorded sensor measurements for each timestamp in the passed list of dataframes.

Calculation

Intersensor averages are computed via the following equation:

\[\bar{x_i} = \frac{1}{M}\sum_{j=1}^{M}x_{ij}\]

where

\(\bar{x_i}\) = intersensor average concentration for time interval i

\(M\) = Number of sensors deployed concurrently

\(x_{ij}\) = Concentration for sensor j and time interval i. For each resulting average \(\bar{x_i}\), all sensor concentration values must be non-null within the time interval i. If one or more sensors recored a null value for the interval i, \(\bar{x_i}\) will be null.

Example

Say you have the following sensor datasets for sensor a, b, and c:

>>> sensor_data_a = df_list[0]
>>> df_list[0]
                     PM25
2021-01-01 00:00:00   2.3
2021-01-01 01:00:00   5.4
2021-01-01 02:00:00   8.5
2021-01-01 03:00:00   4.7
2021-01-01 04:00:00   3.4

>>> sensor_data_b = df_list[1]
>>> df_list[1]
                       PM25
2021-01-01 00:00:00    1.62
2021-01-01 01:00:00    4.41
2021-01-01 02:00:00    7.20
2021-01-01 03:00:00  np.nan
2021-01-01 04:00:00    2.61

>>> sensor_data_c = df_list[2]
>>> df_list[2]
                      PM25
2021-01-01 00:00:00   2.31
2021-01-01 01:00:00   6.34
2021-01-01 02:00:00  10.37
2021-01-01 03:00:00   5.43
2021-01-01 04:00:00   3.74

Computing the average for each hour where all sensors are measuring concurrently, we find the intersensor average to be:

>>> intersensor_average_df = sensortoolkit.calculate.intersensor_mean(df_list, deploy_dict)
>>> intersensor_average_df
                     PM25_avg
2021-01-01 00:00:00     2.076
2021-01-01 01:00:00     5.383
2021-01-01 02:00:00     8.690
2021-01-01 03:00:00    np.nan
2021-01-01 04:00:00     3.250

Note that no average is computed for the 3:00 timestamp, as the dataset for sensor b contains a null value for this timestamp. Intersensor averages are only computed for instances where all sensors are recording concurrently.

Functions

intersensor_mean

Compute the average of each parameter across concurrently recorded sensor datasets.
